text: Julius La Rosa (January 2, 1930 - May 12, 2016) was an American traditional pop music singer. La Rosa was born in Brooklyn, New York. He worked in both radio and television beginning in the 1950s. He was known for his songs "Anywhere I Wander", "Manhattan", and "Eh, Cumpari". LaRosa died of natural causes on May 12, 2016 at his home in Crivitz, Wisconsin, aged 86.Singer Julius La Rosa, fired on Godfrey show, dies at 86 ==References== ==Other websites== *Official website * Category:1930 births Category:2016 deaths Category:American pop singers Category:Musicians from Brooklyn Category:Singers from New York City
title: Julius La Rosa
